  • Target range

Target rangeÂ¶

The basic behavior when editing the target range is as follows: If a target range has not been defined yet for the corresponding KPI, the field for the target range is filled with a placeholder (text). If a value already exists, it is displayed.

As soon as the field is enabled for editing by one of the methods mentioned (clicking, pressing the Enter key or F2 key), in both cases you can specify any valid expression for the target range or modify existing values. When you confirm with the Enter key and the validity check is positive, the target range expression is saved.

Valid expressions for the target range include combinations of these characters

  • >
  • <
  • (
  • )
  • >=
  • <=

the logical operators

  • and
  • or
  • not

as well as whole and real numbers.

An example of a valid target range expression would be:

  • (> 10 and < 20) or -5

An entered target value is always checked against the current actual value of the associated KPI. This results in a positive or negative state depending on whether the actual value is in the target range. This state is displayed in the table by a traffic light with two states.
